com.eemi.ext4j.client.chart.axis

Class AbstractAxis

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.eemi.ext4j.client.core.JsObject
      • com.eemi.ext4j.client.chart.axis.AbstractAxis
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CategoryAxis, GaugeAxis, NumericAxis, RadialAxis

    public abstract class AbstractAxis
extends JsObject
    Base class for all axis classes.

      • setGrid

        public void setGrid(boolean value)
        The grid configuration enables you to set a background grid for an axis. If set to true on a vertical axis, vertical lines will be drawn. If set to true on a horizontal axis, horizontal lines will be drawn. If both are set, a proper grid with horizontal and vertical lines will be drawn.

        You can set specific options for the grid configuration for odd and/or even lines/rows. Since the rows being drawn are rectangle sprites, you can set to an odd or even property all styles that apply to Ext.draw.Sprite. For more information on all the style properties you can set please take a look at Ext.draw.Sprite. Some useful style properties are opacity, fill, stroke, stroke-width, etc.

        The possible values for a grid option are then true, false, or an object with { odd, even } properties where each property contains a sprite style descriptor object that is defined in Sprite.

        Parameters:
        value -

      • setGrid

        public void setGrid(GridConfig value)
        The grid configuration enables you to set a background grid for an axis. If set to true on a vertical axis, vertical lines will be drawn. If set to true on a horizontal axis, horizontal lines will be drawn. If both are set, a proper grid with horizontal and vertical lines will be drawn.

        You can set specific options for the grid configuration for odd and/or even lines/rows. Since the rows being drawn are rectangle sprites, you can set to an odd or even property all styles that apply to Ext.draw.Sprite. For more information on all the style properties you can set please take a look at Ext.draw.Sprite. Some useful style properties are opacity, fill, stroke, stroke-width, etc.

        The possible values for a grid option are then true, false, or an object with { odd, even } properties where each property contains a sprite style descriptor object that is defined in Sprite.

        Parameters:
        value -

      • setGrid

        public void setGrid(java.lang.String oddStroke,
           java.lang.String evenStroke)
        The grid configuration enables you to set a background grid for an axis. If set to true on a vertical axis, vertical lines will be drawn. If set to true on a horizontal axis, horizontal lines will be drawn. If both are set, a proper grid with horizontal and vertical lines will be drawn.

        You can set specific options for the grid configuration for odd and/or even lines/rows. Since the rows being drawn are rectangle sprites, you can set to an odd or even property all styles that apply to Ext.draw.Sprite. For more information on all the style properties you can set please take a look at Ext.draw.Sprite. Some useful style properties are opacity, fill, stroke, stroke-width, etc.

        The possible values for a grid option are then true, false, or an object with { odd, even } properties where each property contains a sprite style descriptor object that is defined in Sprite.

      • setMajorTickSteps

        public void setMajorTickSteps(double value)
        If minimum and maximum are specified it forces the number of major ticks to the specified value. If a number of major ticks is forced, it wont search for pretty numbers at the ticks
        Parameters:
        value -

      • setMinorTickSteps

        public void setMinorTickSteps(double value)
        The number of small ticks between two major ticks. Default is zero.
        Parameters:
        value -

      • setLength

        public void setLength(double value)
        Offset axis position. Default's 0. Defaults to: 0
        Parameters:
        value -

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition(Position position)
        Where to set the axis. Available options are left, bottom, right, top. Default's bottom. Defaults to: "bottom"
        Parameters:
        position -

      • setFields

        public void setFields(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> fields)
        The fields of model to bind to this axis. For example if you have a data set of lap times per car, each having the fields: 'carName', 'avgSpeed', 'maxSpeed'. Then you might want to show the data on chart with ['carName'] on Name axis and ['avgSpeed', 'maxSpeed'] on Speed axis.
        Parameters:
        fields -

      • setFields

        public void setFields(java.lang.String... fields)
        The fields of model to bind to this axis. For example if you have a data set of lap times per car, each having the fields: 'carName', 'avgSpeed', 'maxSpeed'. Then you might want to show the data on chart with ['carName'] on Name axis and ['avgSpeed', 'maxSpeed'] on Speed axis.
        Parameters:
        fields -
